title: Confusing warning caused by caches of renamed cask
body:
### `brew doctor` output

```shell
Your system is ready to brew.
```

### Verification

- [x] I ran `brew update` twice and am still able to reproduce my issue.
- [x] My "`brew doctor` output" above says `Your system is ready to brew` or a definitely unrelated `Tier` message.
- [x] This issue's title and/or description do not reference a single formula e.g. `brew install wget`. If they do, open an issue at https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/issues/new/choose instead.

### `brew config` output

```shell
HOMEBREW_VERSION: 4.5.9-37-gb631179
ORIGIN: https://github.com/Homebrew/brew
HEAD: b631179579390dfe6981199ffe7da7096724a1bc
Last commit: 23 hours ago
Branch: main
Core tap JSON: 12 Jul 16:32 UTC
Core cask tap JSON: 12 Jul 16:32 UTC
HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew
HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: []
HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 14
HOMEBREW_SORBET_RUNTIME: set
Homebrew Ruby: 3.4.4 => /opt/homebrew/Library/Homebrew/vendor/portable-ruby/3.4.4/bin/ruby
CPU: 14-core 64-bit arm_brava
Clang: 17.0.0 build 1700
Git: 2.50.1 => /opt/homebrew/bin/git
Curl: 8.7.1 => /usr/bin/curl
macOS: 15.5-arm64
CLT: 16.4.0.0.1.1747106510
Xcode: N/A
Rosetta 2: false
```

### What were you trying to do (and why)?

When running `brew update` I noticed the following message:

```
==> Migrating cask google-cloud-sdk to gcloud-cli
```

I then proceeded to run `brew upgrade` and `brew cleanup`.

### What happened (include all command output)?

When running `brew cleanup` a confusing warning about renaming of the already migrated cask shows up:

```shellsession
$ brew cleanup --dry-run
Warning: Cask google-cloud-sdk was renamed to gcloud-cli.
Would remove (broken link): /opt/homebrew/bin/pnpm
Would remove (broken link): /opt/homebrew/bin/pnpx
Would remove (broken link): /opt/homebrew/bin/yarn
Would remove (broken link): /opt/homebrew/bin/yarnpkg
$ brew cleanup
Warning: Cask google-cloud-sdk was renamed to gcloud-cli.
Pruned 4 symbolic links from /opt/homebrew
```

Repeated `brew cleanup` run keeps showing the warning.

It turns out to be the download cache located at `~/Library/Caches/Homebrew/Cask/google-cloud-sdk--529.0.0.tar.gz` triggering the warning.

### What did you expect to happen?

I expect Homebrew to deal with the cache during migrating/cleaning up, or at least make it obvious what caused the warning.

### Step-by-step reproduction instructions (by running `brew` commands)

```shell
$ brew cleanup --dry-run
$ touch ~/Library/Caches/Homebrew/Cask/google-cloud-sdk--529.0.0.tar.gz
$ brew cleanup --dry-run
Warning: Cask google-cloud-sdk was renamed to gcloud-cli.
```
